page.title: 04Employment(Harold Wood)
page.content: A random sample of 100 families was taken. 52 mothers work, 15 full time, 37 part-time. Of these 30 do secretarial work, 13 work in shops, 2 run their own business, 1 is a nurse, 3 do domestic work, 1 works in a pub and 2 work at home. In the 100 sample, 97 fathers work at the following occupations. 3 run their own businesses, 7 are policemen,3 work in education, 10 hold managerial jobs, 10 work in finance, 4 work in telecommunications, 3 are in the printing trade, 1 is a physicist, 1 is a solicitor, 16 work in offices, 1 is a jeweller, 1 is a fish merchant, 2 are surveyors, 8 are drivers, 10 work in building trades and 17 are in industry. The discrepancy of 3 is not due to unemployment but to single parent families.
